snippet: The Supreme Court will consider whether the Affordable Care Act allows tax subsidies in those states that did not set up exchanges for people to select their health insurance.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to hear challenge to Affordable Care Act over issue of tax subsidies given to people in states that opt not to run their own health care exchanges; challengers argue that subsidies are being provided unlawfully in three dozen states; outcome of case could affect ability of millions to buy coverage.

byline.contributor: Reed Abelson contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court will consider whether the Affordable Care Act allows tax subsidies in those states that did not set up exchanges for people to select their health insurance.

headline.main: Justices to Hear New Challenge to Health Law
headline.print_headline: Justices to Hear New Challenge to Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
